result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D. Hartline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--mental health assessment and follow through with recommendation
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no contact with Kassandra Olson unless she and probation agent agree contact is appropriate

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D. Hartline

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven D. Hartline
Current: PO Box 143, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2016)
Prior: 314 N. Montgomery Street, Watertown, WI 53094
NOI mailed to Defendant - Returned w/COA from UMS. (Fwd to updated address on 10/28/16)
of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.
Copy of findings of fact and order of FCC submitted over the bench
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Case called at 1:31pm [mo]
Defendant Steven D. Hartline in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
--Victim Impact Statement submitted

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Svehlek
The Court questions Mr. Hartline about the incident and child custody status; further he questions Mr. Hartline about Family Case: 09FA344


The Court Orders 90 days in Jefferson County Jail and STAYS it for one year on Probation, with the following conditions: 

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--mental health assessment and follow through with recommendation
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no precense in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no contact with Kassandra Olson unless she and probation agent agree contact is appropriate
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court orders that Mr. Hartline is to report to Probation by end of business Monday. 
recess:2:05pm

Case called at 3:32 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Steven D. Hartline in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek:  Requests matter be set for plea/sentencing, but do need some time to further review with Mr. Hartline. Requests matter be set next week Friday in the afternoon
Court continues bond
Recess: 3:33 pm

NEXT: -Notices given in Court -  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:10am. 
Defendant Steven D. Hartline in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the address listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Kassandra Olson or any members of her family, this includes no communication by means of texts, voicemail, by computer or Facebook
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 9:16am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/13/15 at 11:00am   (2)  Status Conference on 5/29/15 at 2:30pm.
